definition: to take blood/to draw blood (e.g. for a test)
to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash

sentences.english: Into the camp, blood tests found Lee's living with HIV in the blood.
sentences.chinese: 进劳教所时，抽血化验查出李的血液中携带艾滋病毒。

sentences.english: Then the nurse drew my blood.
Why every time a few times should my exsanguinate assay smoke what just go out to come?
sentences.chinese: 为什么每次我抽血化验都要抽几次才出的来呢？

sentences.english: Is irritability purpura investigates allergic source exsanguinate?
sentences.chinese: 过敏性紫癜查过敏源是抽血吗？

sentences.english: She found it very funny and entertaining to draw blood from suspects and arrestees.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得从嫌疑人和被捕者身上抽血十分有趣。

sentences.english: An old lady was standing there.
sentences.chinese: 抽血的老太太站立在那儿。

sentences.english: The doctors wanted blood tests first to find out what was she sick with.
sentences.chinese: 医生首先要抽血化验，以了解她的病因。

sentences.english: Every time Miss Yang was also blood tests, "tests at least 5 times."
sentences.chinese: 每次杨女士也被抽血化验，“化验至少有5次”。

definition: to do a blood test/to have one's blood tested
chemical examination/to do a lab test
intravenous infusion/to get put on an IV

to give or have an injection
